page.title: 10Life on Coley Farm, Colwich
page.content: The farmer at Far Coley starts work at 7.00 each day. He has a full time employee and a part time employee. The father of the farmer still owns the farm but no longer lives there. He spends some time each day at the farm taking care of all the paper work. Each day the cows are milked twice, and jobs concerned with caring for the herd are undertaken every day of the year. These jobs include milking, cleaning out, feeding, bedding the calves and checking the cycles in order that insemination can be carried out at the correct time. The rest of the time is used for maintenance of hedges, fences machinery and woodland. The farmer also has to plough and fertilize the land, and sow and spray the crops. Harvesting is contracted out. He also has grass to mow and store for silage.
